Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: 207.  To love the convert [to Judaism] as it says “and you shall love the convert” ( Devarim 10:19)

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: I love that the LORD should hear my voice and my supplications.

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: To love him, as it is stated, "And thou shalt love the LORD thy God" (Deuteronomy 6:5, Deuteronomy 11:1)

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: “When our love was strong, we slept on the width of a sword. Now that our love is not strong, even a bed of sixty cubits could not hold us.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: For Thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and love her dust.

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: But he who sins against me despoils his soul; all who hate me love death.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: I love them that love me, And those that seek me earnestly shall find me.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Thou shalt not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I am the LORD.

Version: Open Mishnah
Content: Any love that is dependent on something, when that thing perishes, so too does the love. [A love]r  that is not dependent on something, does not ever perish. What's an example of a love that is

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee; reprove a wise man, and he will love thee.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Draw me, we will run after thee; The king hath brought me into his chambers; We will be glad and rejoice in thee, We will find thy love more fragrant than wine! Sincerely do they love thee.

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: acceptance of afflictions: He accepts afflictions with love.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: LORD, I love the habitation of Thy house, and the place where Thy glory dwelleth.

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: 10:19	You must also show love toward the foreigner, since you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Many waters cannot quench love, Neither can the floods drown it; If a man would give all the substance of his house for love, He would utterly be contemned.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan; Very pleasant hast thou been unto me; Wonderful was thy love to me, Passing the love of women.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: and showing mercy unto the thousandth generation of them that love Me and keep My commandments.

Version: Tractate Berakot by A. Cohen, Cambridge University Press, 1921
Content: Yes, they may be considered an altar of atonement, but not chastenings of love.

Version: The Rashi chumash by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: And if the man-servant will say: I love my master, my wife [the bondswoman] and my children; I shall not go out free,

Version: Tractate Berakot by A. Cohen, Cambridge University Press, 1921
Content: R. Johanan said :  Plagues and childlessness are not to be considered chastenings of love.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And he said: I love thee, O LORD, my strength.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: SAMECH. I hate them that are of a double mind; but Thy law do I love.

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: How long, O simpletons, will you love deception, and scoffers lust mockery, and fools hate wisdom?

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Therefore I love Thy commandments Above gold, yea, above fine gold.

Ref: Abraham Cohen Footnotes to the English Translation of Masechet Berakhot 61b:11
Version: Tractate Berakot by A. Cohen, Cambridge University Press, 1921
Content: I.e. thy life to prove thy love of God.

Version: Akeydat Yitzchak by Eliyahu Munk
Content: The Torah emphasizes the positive aspects of love by commanding "love your fellowman like yourself," i.e. when that fellowman is similar to yourself. (Leviticus 19, 18) Love is not demanded for those utterly unlike you, such as animals etc.

Version: Pentateuch with Rashi's commentary by M. Rosenbaum and A.M. Silbermann
Content: לאהביו are those who do the commandments out of love.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Better is open rebuke Than love that is hidden.

Version: Open Mishnah
Content: With ten tests Abraham, our father, was tested - and he withstood them all; in order to show how great his love was, peace be upon him.

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: Do not love sleep lest you grow poor. Open your eyes and be sated with bread.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: A lovely hind and a graceful doe, Let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; With her love be thou ravished always.

Version: William Davidson Edition - English
Content: That was also taught in a baraita: One does not recite: An eternal love [ahavat olam]; rather, one recites: An abounding love. And the Rabbis say that one recites: An eternal love, and so it says: “And an eternal love I have loved you, therefore I have drawn you with kindness” (Jeremiah 31:2).

Version: Sefer Ha-ikkarim, Jewish Publication Society of America, 1929
Content: Chapter thirty-seven inquires whether it is possible that love may proceed from God to man, pointing out that there are three kinds of love, love of similarity, natural love and love of relation

Version: Rabbi Mike Feuer, Jerusalem Anthology
Content: Request the welfare of Jerusalem; may those who love you enjoy tranquility.

Version: William Davidson Edition - English
Content: The Gemara continues: Canaan commanded his sons with regard to five matters that are apparently normal behavior for slaves: Love one another, love robbery, love promiscuity, hate your masters, and do not speak the truth.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights! .

Version: Open Mishnah
Content: Shemayah and Avtalyon received from them. Shemayah says, "Love work, hate lordship and do not become familiar with the government."

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: In return for my love they are my adversaries; But I am all prayer.

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: Any love that is dependent on something transient: that does not last. When the thing that was the cause for that love perishes, the love will also perish. But any love that is not dependent on

Version: The Rashi chumash by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: ["And you shall love, etc." What is this love?] And these things that I command you this day [(They should be like a "new edict" to you)] shall be upon your heart [(for you thereby come to know the Holy One Blessed be He and to cleave to His ways)].

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: My beloved spoke, and said unto me: ‘Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance, And that I may fill their treasuries.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Hatred stirreth up strifes; but love covereth all transgressions.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: O see how I love Thy precepts; Quicken me, O LORD, according to Thy lovingkindness.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And the LORD said unto me: ‘Go yet, love a woman beloved of her friend and an adulteress, even as the LORD loveth the children of Israel, though they turn unto other gods, and love cakes of raisins.

Version: The Rashi chumash by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: And you shall love the L-rd your G-d [(Do His mitzvoth out of love)], with all your heart [(with both of your inclinations)] and with all your soul [(even if He takes your soul)] and with all your might [(with all your wealth — this, for one whose wealth is more beloved of him than his soul)].

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: MEM. O how love I Thy law! It is my meditation all the day.

Version: Akeydat Yitzchak by Eliyahu Munk
Content: The term "love" is reserved for the whole person. "Love the Lord your G'd;" "love your fellowman like yourself,” i.e. identification with the other party is love. Such an identification is based on a

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Thou art all fair, my love; And there is no spot in thee.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth— For thy love is better than wine.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Thine ointments have a goodly fragrance; Thy name is as ointment poured forth; Therefore do the maidens love thee.

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: Come, let us sate ourselves with love until the morning; let us rejoice in love-making.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: ’Stay ye me with dainties, refresh me with apples; For I am love-sick.’

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: He hath brought me to the banqueting-house, And his banner over me is love.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: I hate and abhor falsehood; Thy law do I love. .

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Great peace have they that love Thy law; And there is no stumbling for them.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: As a lily among thorns, So is my love among the daughters.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: ’From afar the LORD appeared unto me.’ ’Yea, I have loved thee with an everlasting love; Therefore with affection have I drawn thee.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: When their carouse is over, They take to harlotry; Her rulers deeply love dishonour.

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: His palate is sweet [(i.e., His words are sweet)] and He is altogether desirable. This is my Beloved and this is my Love, O daughters of Jerusalem.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Love ye therefore the stranger; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely; For Mine anger is turned away from him.
